speaker: 70'S TV REPORTER
line: I'm here in pasadena with the nasa mission control team as they celebrate scientific history. The first close up photographic transmissions of mars from the viking observer spacecraft. Photos that have created something of a stir by revealing surprising that some speculate could have possibly sustained life on the planet. Even more controversial is officials are denying it as an indication of an alien civilization. Cut to interview w/ LT COL MARCUS AURELIUS BELT - Viking Orbiter Project Director

speaker: 70'S BELT
line: No, it's nothing more than a trick of light and shadows, a geologic anomaly. I'm afraid the only sculptors at work are the solar winds that blow across the surface of Mars at 300 miles an hour ten months a year.

speaker: YOUNG BELT IN SPACE
line: I'm seeing......I've got......

speaker: HOUSTON
line: How's it going out there?

speaker: YOUNG BELT
line: There's something out here!

speaker: HOUSTON
line: Can you repeat that Commander Belt?

speaker: YOUNG BELT
line: It's coming at me! Holy God!

speaker: FLORIDA
line: Pick up terminal sequence, NPS. You have a go to proceed.

speaker: SHUTTLE
line: Booster hydraulic power units have started.

speaker: SHUTTLE LAUNCH CONTROL
line: This is Shuttle Launch Control with T minus one minute 15 seconds and counting.

speaker: SHUTTLE
line: OTC to CDR. How do you read?

speaker: FLORIDA MC
line: Loud and clear OVCC, go ahead.

speaker: SHUTTLE
line: Roger that. OVCC verified. Port set up two zero.

speaker: FLORIDA MC
line: Copy set up two zero.

speaker: SHUTTLE
line: CDR Houston, how do you read?

speaker: MICHELLE GENEROO
line: Loud and clear.

speaker: FLORIDA MC
line: Side hatch close out and white room configuration is complete. Retracting orbiter arm.

speaker: SHUTTLE
line: OMS pressure on. Cabin vent complete.

speaker: FLORIDA MC
line: Roger, we see that. All systems go for APU start. Transfer to internal power now.

speaker: SHUTTLE
line: Pre-start complete. APU to inhibit.

speaker: FLORIDA MC
line: Oxygen vent hood retracted. External tank is at flight pressure. Lock your visors and initiate your O2 flow. Ya'll have a good trip.

speaker: SHUTTLE
line: Roger that.

speaker: SHUTTLE LC
line: T minus 20 seconds and counting.

speaker: FLORIDA MC
line: Go for auto sequence start. Booster power hydraulic units have started. Go for main engine start.

speaker: SHUTTLE LC
line: T minus ten, nine, eight, seven, six, five, four, three -

speaker: FLORIDA MC
line: Abort lift off. Abort lift off. System failure. Abort lift off. Repeat. We have an abort lift off at T minus three seconds.

speaker: SCULLY
line: What did the note say?

speaker: MULDER
line: Just that they worked for NASA. They wanted to talk to somebody from the FBI.

speaker: SCULLY
line: Why the cloak and dagger routine?

speaker: MULDER
line: I have no idea.

speaker: SCULLY
line: Think it's a crank?

speaker: MULDER
line: It's beginning to look that way.

speaker: MICHELLE
line: My name is Michelle Generoo.

speaker: MULDER
line: Fox Mulder...

speaker: MICHELLE
line: I sent you the note.

speaker: SCULLY
line: Hi. Special Agent Dana Scully.

speaker: MICHELL
line: I'm sorry to have to take these precautions. I flew up from Houston this morning. I work at the Space Center there.

speaker: MULDER
line: In what capacity?

speaker: MICHELL
line: I'm the Mission Control Communications Commander for the Space Shuttle Program.

speaker: SCULLY
line: What brings you to Washington?

speaker: MICHELLE
line: I have reason to believe there may be a saboteur at work inside NASA.

speaker: MULDER
line: Do you have evidence of sabotage?

speaker: MICHELLE
line: I don't know. I may. Two weeks ago, a shuttle mission was scrubbed three seconds before lift off when an auxiliary power unit valve malfunctioned. If the flight had not been aborted, there was a great chance the liquid fuel system and the Orbiter would have exploded on the launch pad. This was sent to me in the mail. It's a material analysis that shows deep grooved scoring marks inside this APU valve. Marks that could have caused a malfunction.

speaker: MULDER
line: Evidence of tampering?

speaker: MICHELLE
line: That's what it looks like, but.. according to the person who gave me your names you have expertise in unexplained phenomena, and what's unexplainable is how and when anybody could have done it.

speaker: SCULLY
line: How do you mean?

speaker: MICHELLE
line: The valve is made of ferrocarbon Titanium. To score, that material would take analysis, they would say that it would be impossible for anyone to do that type of damage undetected.

speaker: SCULLY
line: Do you have any idea who may have sent that to you?

speaker: MICHELLE
line: No. No idea. But I can tell you that the official analysis of the malfunction was simple mechanical failure.

speaker: MULDER
line: Does anybody share your suspicions?

speaker: MICHELLE
line: If they do, they're not talking to the FBI. I believe in the space program. I believe in the people who run it, but there's another launch window tomorrow and my reasons may sound selfish, but my fiancee is a shuttle commander on that mission.

speaker: SCULLY
line: Why would somebody want to sabotage the Space Shuttle?

speaker: MULDER
line: Well, if you were a terrorist, there probably isn't a more potent symbol of American progress and prosperity. And if you're an opponent of big science, NASA itself represents a vast money trench that exists outside the crucible and debate of the democratic process. And of course there are those futurists who believe the Space Shuttle is a rusty old bucket that should be mothballed. A dinosaur spacecraft built in the 70's by scientists setting their sights on space in an ever declining scale.

speaker: SCULLY
line: And we thought we could rest easy with the fall of the Soviet Union.

speaker: MULDER
line: Not to mention certain fringe elements who accuse our government itself of space sabotage. The failure of the Hubble Telescope and the Mars Observer are directly connected to a conspiracy to deny us evidence.

speaker: SCULLY
line: Evidence of what?

speaker: MULDER
line: Alien civilizations.

speaker: SCULLY
line: Oh, of course.

speaker: MULDER
line: Wow, look at that â€“ Gemini 8.

speaker: SCULLY
line: What?

speaker: MULDER
line: Well, the man we're gonna see? Col Marcus Aurelius Belt nearly died on that mission. Had to make an emergency landing right in the middle of the Pacific Ocean.

speaker: SCULLY
line: You remember all that stuff?

speaker: MULDER
line: You never wanted to be an astronaut when you were a kid, Scully?

speaker: SCULLY
line: Guess I missed that phase.

speaker: BELT
line: Come in.

speaker: SCULLY
line: Col. Belt, I'm Special Agent Dana Scully. And this is...

speaker: MULDER
line: Col. Belt. Fox Mulder. I'm a big fan. It's an honor to meet you. Y-you were a big hero to me when I was a kid.

speaker: BELT
line: Thank you.

speaker: MULDER
line: I-I stayed up all night when I was 14 to watch your space walk.

speaker: BELT
line: Well, now it's like a stroll around the block. So... how can I help you?

speaker: SCULLY
line: This found its way to the FBI. Do you recognize it?

speaker: BELT
line: Sure, it's an auxiliary power unit valve.

speaker: SCULLY
line: Do you have any reason to believe that the damage done to it was in an effort to sabotage the Space Shuttle Program?

speaker: BELT
line: No.

speaker: SCULLY
line: Do you have any reason to suspect sabotage at all?

speaker: BELT
line: No reason whatsoever. And if you have any respect for this program and for the people who have devoted their lives to it, you'll be careful to whom you make those accusations.

speaker: SCULLY
line: Looking at this evidence, sir, would you consider postponing the shuttle flight until a full investigation could be conducted?

speaker: BELT
line: Look, I don't know where you got this specious artifact, but I can assure you every precaution has been taken to rectify the problem. We've been waiting two weeks for a window to initiate this mission. We've got a payload to deliver.

speaker: SCULLY
line: Col. Belt, has an internal investigation ever been done on this matter?

speaker: BELT
line: The part you have here, has been installed, inspected, and designed by over 100 highly trained technicians. With the security measures we take, it would be virtually impossible for one man working by himself, or two or four men, to do what you are suggesting. I can assure you there isn't a person in this facility that doesn't want to see that shuttle go into space, complete its mission, and come back like winged victory herself. And in about ten hours, God willing, you're gonna see just that.

speaker: MULDER
line: Do you think there would be a problem with us watching lift off from Mission Control?

speaker: BELT
line: Well, being that you'd probably go over my head anyway, please, be my guest.

speaker: MULDER
line: It was an honor, sir.

speaker: SCULLY
line: Thank you. Didn't you want to get his autograph?

speaker: TECHMECH GUY
line: Where did you say you got this?

speaker: SCULLY
line: It came to us anonymously.

speaker: TECHMECH GUY
line: Well this is an APU valve all right, but this doesn't make sense.

speaker: SCULLY
line: What doesn't make sense?

speaker: TECHMECH GUY
line: This scoring here. This valve is made out of ferrocarbon titanium. Its -

speaker: MULDER
line: You didn't order the analysis?

speaker: TECHMECH GUY
line: No, I've never seen this before. But we're on outside contract to NASA. They may have ordered it.

speaker: MULDER
line: But as a matter of course wouldn't you order a material analysis if a part malfunctioned?

speaker: TECHMECH GUY
line: Every shuttle has flown with that same APU valve. We haven't had a problem. To do an analysis and redesign would delay the program for months, not to mention the cost.

speaker: SCULLY
line: Is it conceivable that in order to avoid these delays, the program is being pushed ahead without proper safety precaution?

speaker: TECHMECH GUY
line: Look, there are about 17000 things that can go wrong with the shuttle, and about 17000 people who make sure they don't. listening)

speaker: SCULLY
line: And who makes the final determination as to its safety?

speaker: TECHMECH GUY
line: Oh we make a recommendation, but ultimately, the decision is Col Belt's.

speaker: MULDER AND SCULLY
line: Thank you.

speaker: SCULLY
line: What do you think?

speaker: MULDER
line: I can't believe how much faith we put in machines.

speaker: SCULLY
line: You think Col Belt knows more than he's saying? That he lied about his knowledge of a saboteur?

speaker: MULDER
line: I can't believe that Col Belt would endanger the lives of those astronauts knowing that something might go wrong. He was an astronaut himself.

speaker: SCULLY
line: So you think this x-ray is bogus?

speaker: MULDER
line: God, I hope so.

speaker: SHUTTLE LAUNCH CONTROL
line: This is Shuttle Launch Control with T minus one minute 40 seconds and counting.

speaker: FLORIDA MISSION CONTROL
line: OTC is go for orbiter access arm retract.
OTC, OVCC verified.

speaker: SHUTTLE
line: Roger that, OVCC verified.

speaker: BELT
line: Here we go.

speaker: SHUTTLE LC
line: This is Shuttle Launch Control with T minus one minute 30 and counting.

speaker: FLORIDA MC
line: Final purge sequence, main engine check.

speaker: SHUTTLE
line: Copy purge sequence. Main engine check.

speaker: OTC
line: Switching off Orbiter's ground supply. On board fuel cells check.

speaker: SHUTTLE
line: Roger, OTC.

speaker: HOUSTON
line: Pick up terminal sequence, MPS.

speaker: SHUTTLE
line: Copy that. OTC to CDR, how do you read?

speaker: FLORIDA MC
line: Loud and clear.

speaker: SHUTTLE
line: CDR Houston, how do you read?

speaker: MICHELLE
line: Loud and clear.

speaker: FLORIDA MC
line: Side hatch close out and white room configuration complete. Retracting Orbiter arm. All systems go for APU start.

speaker: SHUTTLE
line: Go with APU start.

speaker: FLORIDA MC
line: PBSR power down and ready for launch. Transfer to internal power.

speaker: SHUTTLE
line: Transfer to internal power.

speaker: FLORIDA MC
line: Gimbaling of main engines complete. Aero surfaces in launch position.

speaker: HOUSTON
line: MPDR assembled. Military recorder is running.

speaker: SHUTTLE
line: Okay, copy.

speaker: FLORIDA MC
line: Oxygen vent hood retracted. External tank is at flight pressure. Ok CDR, lock your visors and initiate your O2 flow. Y'all have a good one.

speaker: SHUTTLE
line: Roger that.

speaker: FLORIDA MC
line: Go for auto sequence start. Booster hydraulic units have started. Go for main engine start.

speaker: SHUTTLE LC
line: T minus ten and counting. 9...8...7...6...5...4...3...2...1...zero. Ignition. We have lift off of the shuttle Orbiter.

speaker: FLORIDA MC
line: CDR Houston, bet y'all have never seen a more beautiful sight.

speaker: MICHELLE
line: Roger that, 10-4.

speaker: FLORIDA MC
line: Roger. Back to you. Lower throttle back. Main engine at 65%.

speaker: FLORIDA MC
line: Roger. Throttle at 110%.

speaker: SHUTTLE
line: Go for SRB separation.

speaker: FLORIDA MC
line: Roger OTC.

speaker: MULDER
line: I have to admit, that fulfilled one of my boyhood fantasies.

speaker: SCULLY
line: Yeah, it ranks right up there with getting a pony and learning how to braid my own hair.

speaker: MULDER
line: Come on, Scully. You have to admit that was exciting. Mission control........countdown.

speaker: MICHELLE
line: Mulder!! Wait! Something's gone wrong.

speaker: MULDER
line: What happened?

speaker: MICHELLE
line: Something's wrong with the shuttle. We had some trouble with the solid rocket boosters, but we were able to fix it. We changed watch, I went home to try to get some sleep. I got a phone call twenty minutes ago. Communication with the shuttle had gone down. Come on. We've got to get back to Houston.

speaker: MULDER
line: They have a press blackout in effect. Chances are, the media doesn't know about it.

speaker: SCULLY
line: Do you think this is sabotage?

speaker: MULDER
line: I don't know. Things go wrong all the time.

speaker: SCULLY
line: Yeah, but they usually fix them, right?

speaker: MULDER
line: Usually.

speaker: SCULLY
line: She's turning.

speaker: MULDER
line: Michelle! I can see her.

speaker: SCULLY
line: Michelle!

speaker: MICHELLE
line: Heeelllp!

speaker: MULDER
line: Kneeling at passenger side of overturned car) You all right?

speaker: MICHELLE
line: I'm stuck!

speaker: SCULLY
line: Can you move?

speaker: MICHELLE
line: Just get me out of here. I'm wedged in!

speaker: MULDER
line: You all right?

speaker: MICHELLE
line: I'm wedged in!

speaker: MULDER
line: C'mere. Can you push with your legs?

speaker: SCULLY
line: Be careful.

speaker: MICHELLE
line: Just get me out of here!

speaker: MULDER
line: Okay, all right. Come on. Okay. Come on Okay.

speaker: SCULLY
line: It's okay. Now don't try to move.

speaker: MICHELLE
line: Oh, I got to get back to Houston.

speaker: MULDER
line: What happened?

speaker: MICHELLE
line: I don't know. Something came at me in the fog, and the next thing I knew I was upside down.

speaker: SCULLY
line: Was it some kind of an animal?

speaker: MICHELLE
line: No. It had a face. It was... it was grotesque. I don't know what it was.

speaker: SCULLY
line: You okay?

speaker: MICHELLE
line: Yeah.

speaker: HOUSTON TECH
line: Orbiter, this is Houston. Do you copy?

speaker: SHUTTLE
line: Your transmission is breaking up, Houston.

speaker: MICHELLE
line: What's happening?

speaker: HOUSTON TECH
line: We have a malf in the OMS and RCF systems. They can't get the Orbiter into attitude rotation. Temperature in the cabin is approaching 103 degrees and they have downlink transmission problems... what happened to you?

speaker: MICHELLE
line: I had an accident. What's their position?

speaker: HOUSTON
line: Just over Eastern Africa.

speaker: MICHELLE
line: Try patching them into the Saychelles Tracking Station. Hang in there OTC.

speaker: MULDER
line: The Orbiter maneuvering system has malfunctioned. Without it they can't rotate the shuttle. They need to rotate it away from the sun to keep the Orbiter cool.

speaker: HOUSTON TECH
line: We've got a drop in cabin pressure, 21 kilopascals and declining.

speaker: MICHELLE
line: They're going to burn up.

speaker: MULDER
line: Where's Col. Belt?

speaker: HOUSTON TECH
line: He's on his way.

speaker: MICHELLE
line: Damn it! What happened when they went to back up?

speaker: HOUSTON TECH
line: Back up system failed to respond.

speaker: MICHELLE
line: Well, what about telemetry? Can we auto-activate their systems from down here?

speaker: HOUSTON TECH
line: We cannot auto-activate! It's like someone's interfering with the telemetry, screwing with the uplink communications from this end.

speaker: MICHELLE
line: Can you trace it?

speaker: HOUSTON TECH
line: It'd have to be a digital processor.

speaker: MICHELLE
line: They'd have to be in the data banks.

speaker: MULDER
line: Where's that?

speaker: MICHELLE
line: Come on.

speaker: SCULLY
line: Mulder?

speaker: MULDER
line: I'm a federal agent. Come on out of there. What are you doing in here?

speaker: CTGG
line: I work here.

speaker: MICHELLE
line: Let me see your clearance.

speaker: CTGG
line: A sensor went off. There was a malfunction in one of the telemetry processors.

speaker: MICHELLE
line: Did you find it?

speaker: CTGG
line: No.

speaker: MULDER
line: Did you see anybody else in here? Okay, call security. I want a search of the premises. I don't want anybody coming in or out of this building who doesn't have proper clearance.

speaker: SHUTTLE
line: .....rotation maneuver.

speaker: HOUSTON
line: I'm breaking up, OTC.

speaker: BELT
line: What's the attitude of the Orbiter?

speaker: HOUSTON TECH
line: They're flying tail first sir, with their belly toward the sun.

speaker: CURLY HAIRED TECH
line: Their flash evaporator system is working, but it's not enough to cool them down.

speaker: HOUSTON TECH
line: Cabin temperature climbing to 116.

speaker: BELT
line: Where's - - -

speaker: MICHELLE
line: Somebody's jamming our transmissions.

speaker: BELT
line: Who do you mean?

speaker: MICHELLE
line: Somebody or something is interfering with our ground communications and scrambling our uplink telemetry. The shuttle is not responding to override signals.

speaker: BELT
line: I'm going to let them fly by wire. I'm cutting off telemetry.

speaker: MICHELLE
line: It might not work. We might lose contact for good.

speaker: BELT
line: We have to give it a chance to work.

speaker: MICHELLE
line: We have to try to bring them down.

speaker: BELT
line: We have to give them control of the ship, take a chance they'll be able to perform that rotation maneuver and deliver their payload.

speaker: MICHELLE
line: What if they can't? We could be stranding them up there.

speaker: BELT
line: Abandon telemetry. Go to fly by wire mode.

speaker: MULDER
line: They're cutting off ground control to the Orbiter. The astronauts will be flying the shuttle all by themselves.

speaker: SCULLY
line: Is it going to work?

speaker: MICHELLE
line: OTC, this is Houston. How's the weather up there?

speaker: SHUTTLE
line: Sunny and warm Houston. What's the forecast?

speaker: MICHELLE
line: OTC, we're going to fly by wire mode. We're going to abort ground control momentarily to see if you can bring those systems back up.

speaker: SHUTTLE
line: Roger that, Houston. And leave the driving to us.

speaker: MICHELLE
line: David... you take care.

speaker: SCULLY
line: What just happened?

speaker: MULDER
line: They cut off contact with the shuttle.

speaker: MICHELLE
line: 45 seconds. If they were able to execute they'd have done it by now.

speaker: BELT
line: Standing by.

speaker: MICHELLE
line: 60 seconds.

speaker: BELT
line: Go to reestablish uplink communication.

speaker: CURLY HAIRED TECH
line: Video signal's failed on them.

speaker: MICHELLE
line: OTC, this is Houston. Do you copy? OTC , this is Houston. Where are you?

speaker: SHUTTLE
line: Howdy-do, Houston. Looks like we finally got this bird to fly right.

speaker: MICHELLE
line: OTC, do you hear that?

speaker: SHUTTLE
line: Music to our ears.

speaker: CURLY HAIRED TECH
line: Cabin temperature stabilizing.

speaker: BELT
line: OTC, this is Mark Belt in Houston. How's the crew holding up?

speaker: SHUTTLE
line: They're looking good, sir.

speaker: BELT
line: Y'all get some rest. We'll get back to work at about 0700.

speaker: SHUTTLE
line: Roger that, Houston.

speaker: BELT
line: Let's get to work on that telemetry problem. We got a big day ahead of us.

speaker: BELT
line: I know you have a lot of questions, and I'll get to them.

speaker: SCULLY
line: How did he know what he did was going to work?

speaker: MICHELLE
line: He didn't. They could have died up there and there would have been nothing we could have done. They'd have been a ghost ship stuck in orbit.

speaker: SCULLY
line: Why would he take that risk?

speaker: MICHELLE
line: Bring those men back without delivering that payload? You're talking millions of wasted dollars. That's all Congress would need to shut down NASA.

speaker: BELT
line: As of 2200 hours, the crew has been conducting onboard tests and tasks and resting up for their first full day in space tomorrow. I'm happy to say after a beautiful night launch the Shuttle Orbiter has performed magnificently.

speaker: SCULLY
line: So much for your boyhood hero.

speaker: MULDER
line: Col. Belt? Col. Belt? Can I talk to you for a moment?

speaker: BELT
line: You want to know why I lied to them. You're asking yourself if this means I'd lie to you. You know what it means to be an astronaut, sir? You risk your life every time you get into your spacecraft for nothing more than the good progress of mankind.

speaker: MULDER
line: You've got no argument from me, sir. You're true American heroes.

speaker: BELT
line: Heroes? We used to make headlines when we did our job right. Now they bury them in the back of the paper. Name me two astronauts on the last shuttle mission. You make the front page today only if you screw up. They only know your name if you're the unlucky SOB sitting on 500 tons of dynamite. That's what they're really waiting for.

speaker: MULDER
line: Sir, I have to ask. I'm sorry, it's my job. Do you think someone is sabotaging the shuttle?

speaker: BELT
line: My answer to you sir, will be to bring those men back safely to earth.

speaker: YOUNG BELT
line: My God!

speaker: HOUSTON
line: How's it going out there?

speaker: YOUNG BELT
line: There's something out here!

speaker: HOUSTON
line: Can you repeat that, Commander Belt?

speaker: YOUNG BELT
line: It's coming at me! Holy God!

speaker: SHUTTLE
line: Uh, Houston, we just heard something weird up here.

speaker: HOUSTON TECH
line: OTC, Houston. Can you describe it?

speaker: SHUTTLE
line: Sort of a dull thump, like something bumped the ship. Got any ideas about that? There it is again.

speaker: CTGG
line: They've got an oxygen leak on board the Orbiter.

speaker: SHUTTLE
line: Our O2 gauges are going all screwy, Houston.

speaker: HOUSTON TECH
line: We got problems. We've got an O2 leak in the main tank.

speaker: MICHELLE
line: What did they say happened?

speaker: HOUSTON TECH
line: They don't know. They just said it was a thump.

speaker: CURLY HAIRED TECH
line: Stand by. We have an astronomer in Winnipeg who just spotted a gaseous cloud about a mile long trailing in our orbit.

speaker: MULDER
line: That's the liquid O2 leaking out into space. The exact same thing happened to Col. Belt on an Apollo mission.

speaker: MICHELLE
line: How much time do they have?

speaker: CURLY HAIRED TECH
line: Well, that's hard to know without accurate telemetry data. I'll do the calculations, but it will just be a guesstimate.

speaker: MICHELLE
line: I need some answers, and where is Col. Belt?

speaker: HOUSTON TECH
line: We can't find him and he was due here 90 minutes ago to begin payload deployment.

speaker: SHUTTLE
line: Uh, Houston? We're up here kind of wondering when we have to start holding our breath.

speaker: MICHELLE
line: We're working on it OTC. I need those calculations and I need a worst case scenario.

speaker: HOUSTON TECH
line: We don't know if one or both of the O2 tanks are damaged.

speaker: MICHELLE
line: Worst case scenario! And then I want someone to find Col. Belt.

speaker: MULDER
line: We'll find Col. Belt.

speaker: HOUSTON TECH
line: They've got thirty minutes of back up oxygen. Beyond that, it's anybody's guess.

speaker: SCULLY
line: Why does she need Belt?

speaker: MULDER
line: She doesn't know how serious the leak is.

speaker: SCULLY
line: It's an oxygen leak. Even I can figure out what happens when you run out of oxygen.

speaker: MULDER
line: Col. Belt's been up there in the same situation before. He'll know better than anybody else what to do. He's got to make the decisions.

speaker: SCULLY
line: Where the hell is he?

speaker: MULDER
line: Col. Belt? Col. Belt!

speaker: SCULLY
line: I'm going to go get security.

speaker: MULDER
line: Col. Belt. Are you all right?

speaker: BELT
line: Yeah. I wasn't feeling well.

speaker: MULDER
line: They need you down at Mission Control, sir. There's been another accident.

speaker: MICHELLE
line: OTC, is your orbital maneuvering system still operational?

speaker: SHUTTLE
line: Roger, Houston. We're ready for reentry. Just say the word.

speaker: BELT
line: How bad's the leak?

speaker: MICHELLE
line: We have no way to determine.

speaker: BELT
line: OTC, What's the condensation, cabin.

speaker: SHUTTLE
line: Windows are getting a little steamy.

speaker: MICHELLE
line: Carbon dioxide buildup.

speaker: BELT
line: Okay, OTC. Everything's going to be fine. I want you to get in your spacesuits and depressurize your cabin, and then I want you to vent that CO2.

speaker: SHUTTLE
line: Roger, Houston. And then what?

speaker: BELT
line: I want you to stay in your suits. And then I want you to prepare to use your emergency oxygen systems. And then I want you...to...deliver your payload.

speaker: MICHELLE
line: Those are men up there.

speaker: BELT
line: You're out of line. You want to tell me how to do my job? I've been up there in that situation, Miss Generoo. There's more at risk here than your personal life. And if you can't accept that or operate effectively in the circumstances then maybe you'd better leave the decisions to people in this room who can. OTC, do you copy?

speaker: SHUTTLE
line: Roger, Houston. We're waiting on those O2 calculations.

speaker: SCULLY
line: Michelle!

speaker: MICHELLE
line: They're going to die.

speaker: MULDER
line: You don't know that.

speaker: MICHELLE
line: It's absolutely unconscionable putting that payload before those men's lives.

speaker: SCULLY
line: I think she's right, Mulder. You saw him in there. He's losing it.

speaker: MULDER
line: He saved their lives earlier.

speaker: SCULLY
line: Did he? Or did he put their lives in unnecessary jeopardy? If he can't deliver that payload, Congress is going to kill the Space Program.

speaker: MULDER
line: And you think killing those astronauts isn't going to have the same effect?

speaker: SCULLY
line: Look, Mulder. I think somebody must have sabotaged the space shuttle because too many things have gone wrong. I think Col. Belt knows about it and he's known about it from the beginning.

speaker: MICHELLE
line: We have to stop him. We've got to pull them out of orbit.

speaker: MULDER
line: He doesn't want those men to die.

speaker: MICHELLE
line: How do you know?

speaker: MULDER
line: I know it. I'm sure of it.

speaker: MICHELLE
line: He's the one who put them up there.

speaker: MULDER
line: And he may be the only person who can get them down alive. Now how can you be certain that what he's doing isn't the right thing? That what he's doing isn't going to save their lives? Now I need access to you records... in a hurry.

speaker: MULDER
line: I need everything on the Hubble Telescope, the Mars Observer, the Shuttle Challenger, and the current Orbiter mission.

speaker: CTGG
line: You're talking about tens of thousands of documents.

speaker: SCULLY
line: What exactly are we looking for?

speaker: MULDER
line: X-rays, diagrams, schematics - - any proof that Belt knew about a sabotage.

speaker: SCULLY
line: A needle in a haystack.

speaker: SHUTTLE
line: Payload deployment initiated.

speaker: HOUSTON
line: Roger that, OTC. Tracking it now.

speaker: SHUTTLE
line: Looks good from here. Payload delivery is complete, Houston. We're awaiting your order.

speaker: BELT
line: System check for reentry deorbit burn.

speaker: SHUTTLE
line: Holy God! There's something outside the ship! There's someone outside the ship!

speaker: BELT
line: Can you repeat that, OTC?

speaker: SHUTTLE
line: There's some kind of.... ghost outside the ship!

speaker: BELT
line: No. Nono. NonoononooooooooooOOOOOOO!!!!

speaker: SCULLY
line: Mulder, I found it. This is the same diagram that was sent to Michelle...ordered by Col. Belt. Which means he knew about the faulty valve.

speaker: MULDER
line: This is from the Challenger. It's the O ring fitting that failed dated January 21, 1986. That's one week before the space shuttle blew up. And the analysis was ordered by Col. Belt.

speaker: SCULLY
line: Are you saying he might have known about the Challenger defect?

speaker: MULDER
line: Something weird is going on here, Scully.

speaker: MICHELLE
line: Col. Belt's collapsed.

speaker: MULDER
line: Where is he?

speaker: MICHELLE
line: He's in his office.

speaker: MICHELLE
line: He was just here.

speaker: SCULLY
line: Oh my God.

speaker: MICHELLE
line: What's wrong with him?

speaker: MULDER
line: Get a doctor.

speaker: BELT
line: Help me. Help me.

speaker: MULDER
line: How can we help you, Col.?

speaker: SCULLY
line: He's having some kind of a seizure, Mulder.

speaker: MICHELLE
line: Come on! Come on, come on!

speaker: BELT
line: It hurts! It's tearing me apart!

speaker: EMT1
line: See if I can get a bus.

speaker: MICHELLE
line: I'm bringing that shuttle down.

speaker: BELT
line: Nooooo! It's out there.

speaker: EMT1
line: Easy, easy.

speaker: BELT
line: Spacesuits!

speaker: MULDER
line: Strap him down.

speaker: SCULLY
line: Give him 10 milligrams of Diazepam.

speaker: MULDER
line: No.

speaker: SCULLY
line: He's going to hurt himself, Mulder.

speaker: MULDER
line: He's trying to tell us something. Col. Belt.

speaker: MICHELLE
line: Those men are up there and they're running out of oxygen.

speaker: BELT
line: They don't have to die.

speaker: MULDER
line: Col. Belt, I want you to focus. Focus your breathing. Focus your pain. Right here.

speaker: EMT1
line: Blood pressure is 174 over 120.

speaker: SCULLY
line: Mulder, you're risking an anuerysm.

speaker: MULDER
line: Focus. Now you're focused. Right here. Now you're going to save those astronauts and you're going to tell me how to do it.

speaker: BELT
line: The shuttle can't survive reentry.

speaker: MICHELLE
line: No, he's lying.

speaker: MULDER
line: How do you know it can't survive?

speaker: BELT
line: The fuselage...the fuselage is damaged. The silicone tiles are destroyed.

speaker: MICHELLE
line: How does he know?

speaker: MULDER
line: How has it been damaged?

speaker: BELT
line: I'm responsible.

speaker: MULDER
line: Did you sabotage the shuttle?

speaker: BELT
line: No, but I couldn't stop them. Nobody can stop them.

speaker: MULDER
line: Stop who?

speaker: EMT1
line: Pulse is 194.

speaker: SCULLY
line: You're going to kill him, Mulder.

speaker: MULDER
line: Stop who?

speaker: BELT
line: They don't want us to know. They don't want us to know.

speaker: MULDER
line: Who?

speaker: BELT
line: It came to me. It lives in me.

speaker: YOUNG BELT
line: It's coming at me. It's coming at me! Get me out of here! It's attacking me! Get me out!

speaker: BELT
line: Get it out. Help me. It's coming back.

speaker: MICHELLE
line: That's the face I saw in the fog.

speaker: EMT1
line: We're losing him. Defib.

speaker: EMT2
line: Here you go.

speaker: EMT1
line: Clear.

speaker: EMT2
line: Hit it.

speaker: HOUSTON TECH
line: We've just run out of oxygen. They've got exactly thirty minutes left in the emergency backup system.

speaker: MICHELLE
line: They're going to suffocate up there. I've got no choice but to bring them down. It's the only chance I've got.

speaker: EMT1
line: Again.

speaker: EMT2
line: Okay, we got O2 standing by.

speaker: EMT1
line: Hold on. We've got vitals. We've got a pulse.

speaker: SCULLY
line: We've got to get him to a hospital.

speaker: MICHELLE
line: OTC, this is Houston Mission Control. Do you copy?

speaker: SHUTTLE
line: Roger, Houston. We've got some spooky stuff up here.

speaker: MICHELLE
line: OTC, we're going to bring you down. We want you to instigate deorbit burn, and begin deceleration.

speaker: SHUTTLE
line: Roger, Houston. Kind of hoping you were going to say that. Activating OMS rockets. All systems go for reentry.

speaker: MULDER
line: They're bringing the shuttle down. You said the shuttle would burn up on reentry. Is there anything we can do to save it?

speaker: BELT
line: Change the trajectory.

speaker: MULDER
line: Change the trajectory to what?

speaker: BELT
line: Change the reentry trajectory to 35 degrees.

speaker: MISSION CONTROL
line: T minus 35 seconds to ionosphere reentry.

speaker: MULDER
line: You've to change the reentry trajectory.

speaker: MICHELLE
line: What?

speaker: MULDER
line: You've got to change it to 35 degrees.

speaker: CURLY HAIRED TECH
line: T minus 30 seconds to ionosphere reentry.

speaker: MULDER
line: Col. Belt- - -

speaker: MICHELLE
line: I can't.

speaker: CURLY HAIRED TECH
line: T minus 25 seconds.

speaker: MULDER
line: It's your only shot.

speaker: MICHELLE
line: We...we...we'd have to change the landing site, we'd have to inform them before the blackout.

speaker: CURLY HAIRED TECH
line: 15 seconds to blackout.

speaker: MICHELLE
line: I want to know what the weather conditions are in Albuquerque. Are we go for an emergency landing?

speaker: HOUSTON TECH
line: Weather in Albuquerque? Landing conditions go in Albuquerque.

speaker: CURLY HAIRED TECH
line: T minus five seconds to blackout.

speaker: MICHELLE
line: OTC, this is Houston. I want you to change your reentry trajectory to 35 degrees. You'll be landing at Kirtland Field in Albuquerque. Do you copy?

speaker: HOUSTON TECH
line: Ionosphere reentry. Temporary blackout in effect.

speaker: MICHELLE
line: Did they get that transmission?

speaker: CURLY HAIRED TECH
line: Two minutes to reestablish.

speaker: MICHELLE
line: Damn it. How much oxygen do we have?

speaker: HOUSTON TECH
line: 16 minutes.

speaker: MICHELLE
line: OTC, this is Houston. Come in, OTC. OTC, this is Houston. Come in OTC. Anything? What's the point of their new reentry?

speaker: HOUSTON TECH
line: 500 miles west of Hawaii.

speaker: MICHELLE
line: See if Hawaii can get me - -

speaker: CURLY HAIRED TECH
line: Hawaii's picked the shuttle up on radar.

speaker: SCULLY
line: They made it.

speaker: HOUSTON TECH
line: Not necessarily.

speaker: CURLY HOUSTON
line: Albuquerque, do you have radar confirmation?

speaker: ALBUQUERQUE
line: Negative, Houston. Nothing on the screen.

speaker: MICHELLE
line: OTC, this is Houston. Come in, OTC. OTC, this is Houston. Come in, OTC.

speaker: SHUTTLE
line: Houston, this is OTC. You know a good place to eat in Albuquerque?

speaker: HOUSTON TECH
line: OTC, welcome home. Welcome home, OTC. You're looking real good.

speaker: SOME GUY
line: Yes!

speaker: MICHELLE
line: The Space Shuttle touched down today at 10:56 Central Standard Time. The Orbiter delivered it's payload after just thirteen orbits and returned to Earth...without incident. We at NASA are looking forward to our next shuttle mission and to future successful explorations of space, for mankind, and the future of mankind.

speaker: SCULLY
line: I just heard.

speaker: MULDER
line: Something had possessed him. Something he must have seen out there in space.

speaker: SCULLY
line: The doctors who examined him said he was experiencing severe dementia.

speaker: MULDER
line: I don't think he ever really knew exactly how it was working through him or that he ever knew...that he was...responsible for his own actions.

speaker: SCULLY
line: He ordered those x-rays of the damaged parts.

speaker: MULDER
line: You saw what I saw, Scully. I think he was trying to warn her. I think that he sent Michelle those x-rays like he was trying to reach out to her without quite knowing why, as if...his own instinctual impulse was to save those men.

speaker: SCULLY
line: While simultaneously trying to kill them?

speaker: MULDER
line: Hey, Scully, we send those men up into space to unlock the doors of the universe, and we don't even know what's behind them. I think what ever it was, he took it with him. And in the end that was the only way he knew how to stop it.

speaker: SCULLY
line: There's an investigation, you know. They haven't ruled out foul play.

speaker: MULDER
line: He gave his own life. As an astronaut, that was something he was prepared to do.

speaker: MINISTER
line: ...for Col. Marcus Aurelius Belt devoted his life to the exploration and understanding of Space, learning its mysteries and experiencing it not just for himself, but for humanity. Lord, take this man's soul and let it rise up to your heavens, higher than he could ever go as a man. Let him know the true nature of the universe that he sought to learn.
